The claim falsely states that the World: WHO) changed COVID-19 testing protocols for political reasons following Joe Biden's inauguration.
The WHO: s guidance in the Jan. 20 memo simply reminded labs to follow the instructions provided by each test's manufacturer, rather than admitting that false-positive cases had been inflating the case count.
The timing of the misinformation: which coincided with Joe Biden's inauguration, raised suspicions about the motives behind these false claims and questioned the trustworthiness of public health agencies.
